name: Labyrinth of Lumina
description:
"In the kingdom of Irydia, everyone can use magic to some extent.

One day, a large, mysterious structure emerges from the land. Inside, an ever changing labyrinth full of strange and magical creatures is found. Deep within, a statue of Lumina, the Irydian goddess, awaits. Many adventurers now come to this place, wishing to reach the statue and pray to the goddess for blessings and miracles."

Labyrinth of Lumina is a fast paced, turn based RPG designed to be played many times, each run being around half an hour depending on your play style. It's light in story and focuses on trying out different party and character configurations.

  • Roll for a random party of four characters, each with their own class, stats, skills, etc.
  • Explore an area consisting of ten randomly generated rooms per run.
  • Fight enemies, level up and collect treasure to power up your party along the way.
  • Battle interface is designed to keep things quick, mapping each action to a button and letting you move your characters freely in your side of the field.
  • Treasure lets you equip skills regardless of character class, increase stats, add special effects, etc.
  • Prepare for the area boss, a powerful enemy you need to defeat to progress.
  • Beat the boss to unlock new areas, classes and class variations.
  • Enemies are visible on the field, no random battles. However, there's no running from battle, so you may want to avoid enemies if you're low on health.
  • Magical springs found frecuently will fully restore the party, but you can also use healing skills or items.
  • Any treasure you find is kept for future runs even if you're defeated, so customization options increase the more you play, whether you beat the boss or not.
  • You can roll as many times as you want until you get a party you like.
  • Randomized character names are gender neutral, though you can freely change them even in the demo without the need to unlock anything.
  • Demo contains two areas and several character classes and class variations.
  • The game autosaves whenever you finish a run, are defeated, or choose to retreat, and it supports keyboard, Xbox/Xinput, PS5 and Switch pro controllers.

The full game should have several more areas, treasure, classes, skills, etc., and will let you unlock direct party customization to change a character's class, talent and personality.

This game started as a test for a grid and turn based RPG battle system. It takes inspiration from the Etrian Odyssey series as well as several other RPGs.
